page.title: 03St. Andrew's Church, Banwell
page.content: In AD704 the first wooden church was built by St. Aldhelm. The village was preserved during successive plagues by the clear water of the Mendip spring. Banwell prospered and a fine stone church was built. Bishop Beckington was largely involved in beautifying the church. In the 20th century electric light and oil fired heating was installed, a new organ was built in 1935 and the number of bells increased to ten. Today, worship is family orientated so that people of all ages can come together. The children's choir of approximately 24 is shortly to be augmented by adults to produce a more balanced choir. The Mothers' Union continues to meet and there is a flourishing Scripture Union Group attracting membership of all ages.
